Gv_example.cpp

This is an example of how to calculate and output the gradB drift velocity of trapped particles in stellarators.
  The gradB drift velocity of trapped particles in stellarators. Physics of Plasmas vol.12,112507(2005).

#include "CStconfig.h"
#include <iostream>


//*********************************************************************
// The example prints the bounce-averade gradB drift velocity of 
// trapped particles averaged over flux surface.
//
int main(int argc, char* argv[])
{ 
  MConf::CStconfig mc("w7x-sc1.bc");
  if(!mc.isOK()) return 1;
  
  mc.truncate(1e-6); // truncate Bmn spectrum at level Bmn/B00 = 1e-6

  std::cout <<"#r/a         G_v,%"<<std::endl;  
  std::cout.precision(3);
  std::cout.setf(std::ios::scientific);

  const int maxP = 30;

  for(int i=0; i<maxP; i++) {
    double x = 0.05+(0.975-0.05)*i/(maxP-1);    // x=sqrt(s)
    double s = x*x;
    std::cout<<x<<" "<<mc.Gv(s)*100<<std::endl;
  }
  
  return 0;
}
